title: Design of a Visual Hybrid Computation and Problem-Solving Learning System for Mathematics Education for Children with Autism

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational special education knowledge, understanding of general pedagogical methodologies, basic mathematics teaching experience, introductory grasp of mathematical concepts (equations, graphs, measurement, probability, statistics, etc.)
context.additional_context: A course for in-service or pre-service teachers to develop the competency of designing personalized math education systems for autistic children, reflecting their cognitive and learning characteristics. Focuses on developing strategies for acquiring math concepts (calculation, problem-solving, spatial reasoning, functional relationships) through visual supports.

learning_goals: Design ≥3 prototypes of math education content reflecting visual learning characteristics of autistic children (formula visualization, graph-based problem-solving, variable manipulation activities)

Applying three core principles of multimedia cognitive learning theory (visual-auditory integration, attention models), learners create a development plan for an interactive educational tool prototype (calculation training module, equation visualization tool, probability simulation) within two weeks and achieve ≥80 points across predefined criteria (functionality 30%, creativity 30%, feasibility 40%)
PBL Team Project: Case Report & Presentation on VHDLS Framework Application – Customized Math Education Design for Autistic Children

Propose ≥5 strategies integrating visual elements (color contrast, dynamic animation, pattern repetition) to enhance attention span in autistic children and establish linkage plans with mathematical concepts (geometry, measurement, sequences, statistics, proofs)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
